-------------------------------
My own pet project which began a really long time ago (still 
incomplete)
http://1happyturtle.com/NSNR/NOsleepNOrest_Intro.htm
I still need to revise some stuff but now I have a general idea on 
Meiji era law enforcement and insight into the careers of MIKI, and 
Fujita Goro (some portions are still in "note" format)

***from the info I documented you would feel that alot of the laws 
were oppressive and pried into the daily lives of citizens...that's 
true but according to the diary of Dr. Baelz up until 1879 he felt 
that the laws in Japan compared to those in his native Germany were 
not troubling...Dr. Baelz somehow managed to keep up with things 
like censorship laws, the decreasing value of paper currency and 
gold. I have to note that Toshiyoshi Kawaji died in 1879 and in the 
1880s alot of changes will occur due to Yamagata Aritomo's increase 
in political power.
